Can’t go to work? Schools closed? Worrie: Can’t go to work? Schools closed? Worried about money? It is normal to feel stressed and overwhelmed.
School shutdown is also a chance to make: School shutdown is also a chance to make better relationships with our children and teenagers.
One-on-One time is free and fun. It make: One-on-One time is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important.
Set aside time to spend with each child: Set aside time to spend with each child
It can be for just 20 minutes, or longer: It can be for just 20 minutes, or longer – it’s up to us. It can be at the same time each day so children or teenagers can look forward to it.
Copy their facial expression and sounds: Copy their facial expression and sounds
Sing songs, make music with pots and spo: Imba nyimbo, fanya muziki na vyungu au vijiko
Tell a story, read a book, or share pict: Tell a story, read a book, or share pictures
Talk about something they like: sports,: Talk about something they like: sports, music, TV, celebrities, friends
Go for a walk – outdoors or around the h: Go for a walk – outdoors or around the home
Exercise together to their favorite musi: Exercise together to their favorite music
Read a book or look at pictures: Read a book or look at pictures
Dance to music or sing songs!: Dance to music or sing songs!
Do a chore together – make cleaning and: Do a chore together – make cleaning and cooking a game!
Listen to them, look at them. Give them: Listen to them, look at them. Give them your full attention. Have fun!
Ask your child what they would like to d: Ask your child what they would like to do
Choosing builds their self confidence. I: Choosing builds their self confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t OK with physical distancing, then this is a chance to talk with them about this. (see next leaflet)
Switch off the TV and phone. This is vir: Switch off the TV and phone. This is virus-free time.
